channel.title: BBC News - Scotland

item.title: Covid: Scotland's international travel testing regime to be relaxed
item.description: Pre-departure tests for fully vaccinated travellers will be scrapped and the system aligned with the rest of the UK.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Where are the latest cases?
item.description: A daily update on the number and location of coronavirus cases in Scotland.

item.title: Hospitals inquiry: Dad claims son given 'secret' supply of drugs
item.description: A dad claims his son was given the medication to protect him from the "dangers" of a Glasgow hospital.

item.title: Petrol queues form despite assurance of supplies in Scotland
item.description: Drivers lined up at forecourts in Scotland after delivery issues at a small number of UK petrol stations.

item.title: What happened to Scotland's state-run energy company?
item.description: In 2017 the Scottish government pledged to set up a not-for-profit energy company by 2021, so what happened?

item.title: Climbers rescued from Old Man of Stoer sea stack
item.description: The pair were winched to safety by a coastguard helicopter after getting into difficulty on the Old Man of Stoer.

item.title: Scottish schoolchildren join global climate protest
item.description: The demonstrations across Scotland come five weeks before Glasgow hosts the COP26 climate summit.

item.title: Struck-off Ayr optician guilty of sex attacks
item.description: Former Ayr optician Ian Jordan, 63, subjected two female clients to "bizarre" examinations.

item.title: Airport arrivals hit by passport gate failure
item.description: Passengers arriving at UK airports suffer delays after an IT problem hits self-service passport gates.

item.title: Leigh Griffiths: Dundee striker charged by police over flare kick
item.description: Dundee striker Leigh Griffiths is charged by Police Scotland in relation to "culpable and reckless" conduct after apparently kicking a flare into a stand of fans.

item.title: Death of man found in burning car 'not suspicious'
item.description: Police say 64-year-old Irvine Wallace from the town died in the incident on Wednesday morning.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: What do we know about the vaccine passport?
item.description: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon has given more details about how Scotland's scheme will operate.

item.title: Vaccine passports: The key questions on the scheme's introduction to Scottish sport
item.description: BBC Scotland examines the key questions surrounding the impact of vaccine passports in Scottish sport.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: 'I'm double-vaccinated but can't show the proof'
item.description: A woman who got one jab in England and one in Scotland says her vaccine certificate only confirms a single dose.

item.title: What difference will jabbing young teens make?
item.description: How to weigh the pros and cons of a vaccine for a disease that is rarely serious in young people.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: What are the rules?
item.description: Scotland's levels system of restrictions have come to an end - but what does that mean people can do?

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: £30bn greenprint for Glasgow
item.description: Glasgow City Council reveals an ambitious plan to rejuvenate the city and reduce its carbon footprint.

item.title: NHS Scotland's 'biggest crisis' in five charts
item.description: Looking at the figures behind the enormous pressures being felt by NHS Scotland

item.title: Strikes and cuts: What is going on at ScotRail?
item.description: The rail operator has been hit by months of strikes, with workers staging a protest outside the FM's residence on Wednesday.

item.title: Swimmers dodge jellyfish on four islands challenge
item.description: The "Salty Selkies" swam for more than six miles from the Bass Rock to Craigleith, Lamb and Fidra in the Firth of Forth.

item.title: Hebridean bothy sale seeks 'active' islander
item.description: Islanders on Eigg hope the single-room property can be home to a new "contributing member of the community".

item.title: In pictures: Scottish archaeological finds
item.description: Three photographers were commissioned to record discoveries made in this year's season of digs.

item.title: What is being done to ease the ambulance 'crisis'?
item.description: The military are being brought in to drive ambulances - but shortages of beds and NHS staff remain.

item.title: Community in race to buy remotest mainland pub
item.description: Locals are facing a challenge from potential private buyers to purchase The Old Forge in Knoydart.

item.title: 'NHS needs more than sticking plasters'
item.description: The Scottish government is accused of "hiding behind Covid" over problems in the NHS.

item.title: COP26: Police dogs in training ahead of the summit in Glasgow
item.description: Police dogs and their handlers are taking part in training exercises ahead of COP26.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: First vaccinated care home resident receives booster dose
item.description: The first care home resident to receive a Covid-19 vaccine in Scotland has been given a booster dose.

item.title: 'Why did my mother wait so long for an ambulance?'
item.description: The son of an elderly woman who had to lie on the floor waiting for an ambulance says he wants answers.

item.title: Ian Blackford challenges Johnson on inflation rate
item.description: SNP Westminster leader Ian Blackford says the government needs a winter plan for working families.

item.title: Callum McGregor: Celtic captain signs five-year contract
item.description: Celtic captain Callum McGregor has signed a new five-year deal, keeping him at the club until 2026.

item.title: URC: Edinburgh & Glasgow look to improve on disappointing seasons
item.description: Edinburgh and Glasgow Warriors endured difficult times last season - will the new campaign bring better for Scotland's pro sides?

item.title: Andy Murray beaten by top seed Hubert Hurkacz in Moselle Open quarter-final
item.description: Britain's former world number one Andy Murray is knocked out of the Moselle Open by Polish top seed Hubert Hurkacz.

item.title: Scottish Gossip: Griffiths, Giakoumakis, Celtic, Hibs, Rangers, Dundee, Aberdeen
item.description: Dundee striker faces five-match ban as Celtic striker's debut is delayed by injury.
